title: Drawing, "Canopy", 1815–22
medium: Watercolor over graphite on off-white coarse laid paper
markings: Stamps: Cooper Union Museum stamp on verso.
inscribed: In brown ink on verso: "Mr..Crace." Traces of inscription in brown ink trimmed at top margin.
creditline: Museum purchase through gift of Mrs. John Innes Kane
description:
Horizontal rectangle. Design for the Royal Pavilion, Brighton. Elevation showing the upper sections of the columns supporting a pagoda-like roof, truncated at top.

Original album associated with this collection still exists.  See 1948-40-1 accessory

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Canopy", 1815–22.
1815–22. Watercolor over graphite on off-white coarse laid paper. Museum purchase through gift of Mrs. John Innes Kane. 1948-40-94.
